text: The vision of Obadiah. Thus hath the Lord GOD said concerning Edom: We have heard the message from the LORD, and a messenger is sent to the Gentiles, Arise, and let us rise up against her in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have made thee small among the Gentiles: thou shalt be greatly humbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pride of thine heart hath deceived thee, thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high; that saith in his heart, Who shall bring me down to the ground?
speaker: Narrator

text: Though thou exalt thyself as the eagle and though thou set thy nest among the stars, from there I will bring thee down, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did thieves come to thee, or robbers by night? (how art thou destroyed!) would they not have stolen until they had enough? if the grapegatherers came to thee, would they not leave some grapes?
speaker: Narrator

text: How were the things of Esau searched out! His hidden things were sought after!
speaker: Narrator

text: All the men of thy confederacy have brought thee even to the border; the men that were at peace with thee have deceived thee and prevailed against thee; those that eat thy bread have laid a wound under thee; there is no intelligence in this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall I not in that day, said the LORD, even destroy the wise men out of Edom and intelligence out of the mount of Esau?
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy mighty men, O Teman, shall be dismayed because every man shall be cut off from mount of Esau by the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy violence against thy brother Jacob, shame shall cover thee, and thou shalt be cut off for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day that thou didst stand on the other side, in the day that the strangers carried away captive his forces, and foreigners entered into his gates and cast lots upon Jerusalem, even thou wast as one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou should not have looked on the day of thy brother in the day that he became a stranger; neither should thou have rejoiced over the sons of Judah in the day they were lost; neither should thou have spoken proudly in the day of distress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou should not have entered into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity; thou should not have looked on their affliction in the day of their calamity, nor have laid hands on their substance in the day of their calamity;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither should thou have stood in the crossway, to kill those of his that did escape; neither should thou have delivered up those of his that remained in the day of distress.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the day of the LORD is near upon all the Gentiles: as thou hast done, it shall be done unto thee; thy reward shall return upon thine own head.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as ye have drunk upon my holy mountain, so shall all the Gentiles drink continually; they shall drink, and they shall swallow down, and they shall be as though they had not been.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in Mount Zion shall be deliverance, and it shall be holiness; and the house of Jacob shall possess their possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau for stubble, and they shall kindle in them and devour them; and there shall not be any remaining of the house of Esau; for the LORD hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those of the south shall possess the mount of Esau and the plains of the Palestinians, and they shall also possess the fields of Ephraim and the fields of Samaria; and Benjamin shall possess Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the captives of this host of the sons of Israel shall possess that of the Canaanites, even unto Zarephath; and the captives of Jerusalem, who shall be in Sepharad, shall possess the cities of the south.
speaker: Narrator

text: And saviours shall come up unto Mount Zion to judge the mount of Esau; and the kingdom shall be the LORDâ€™s.
speaker: Narrator
